s2.title: Downloading what you need
s2.p:
For &xslt4c-current;, we are distributing the following:
32-bit and 64-bit AIX 5.1 builds with the xlC_r v6.0 compiler
32-bit and 64-bit HP-UX 11 builds with the aCC v3.52 compiler
32-bit Red Hat Linux 8.0 build with the gcc 3.2 compiler
32-bit and 64-bit Solaris 2.8 builds with the Forte C++ 6 Update 2 compiler
64-bit SuSE Linux 8.1 for AMD-64 build with the gcc 3.2.2 compiler
32-bit Windows build with the Microsoft Visual C++ 6.0 compiler with Service Pack 5
As with previous releases, the documentation build containing this User's Guide and API documentation will be provided in a separate distribution.
Please contact us at if you would like to help provide builds for other platforms.
If you do not already have it, you must also download the &xml4c-used; build as indicated below.
s2.note: The Xalan distribution files are in . The Xerces distribution files are in . Xalan documentation is provided in a separate package from the binary distribution files. For Windows, documentation is packaged with the file name &xslt4c-docs_dist_zip;. For UNIX, documentation is packaged with the file name of &xslt4c-docs_dist_targz;.
s2.p:
The compiler version used for each platform is listed in the table below.
Platform - Operating System Compilers
AIX 5.1 IBM C and C++ for AIX 6.00
HP/UX 11.i aCC A.03.52
RedHat Linux 8.0 gcc Compiler, version 3.2
Solaris 2.8 Sun Workshop 6 update 2
SuSE 8.0 gcc Compiler, version 3.2.2
Windows NT, 2000, and XP Microsoft Visual C++ with SP5
s2.note: Use GNU tar to untar the Solaris distribution file; see A tar checksum error on Solaris .
s2.p: If you want to take advantage of the support for number formatting, sorting, and encoding the ICU provides, you should also download and install the ; see Using the ICU,
s2.note: To access previous releases of &xslt4c;, visit the Xalan-C archive directory.
